body: Hey @enumag, can you reproduce the issue on https://psalm.dev ?

I think we can put logic to report formatters (they inherits from https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/master/src/Psalm/Report.php).

For example - console formatter - https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/d8cd30b34a438e5e980533922fc18bea49bc7402/src/Psalm/Report/ConsoleReport.php#L37-L39
Can I configure Psalm to use my custom Report implementation?

AFAIK, no you can't.

But we can introduce new option to current report formatter to show file links in IDE-compatible way.

Where formatters instantiated:
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/4bfdda597efc724e44d89a75dc71adc849140c55/src/Psalm/IssueBuffer.php#L631-L704
@andrew-demb One issue is that the link needs to contain an absolute path to the file. `IssueData::$file_name` is relative. How can I get the absolute path in `ConsoleReport`?
I don't know codebase so much, but I think we can add argument in `getOutput()` - `string $base_dir` and put to it value from config - `$project_analyzer->getConfig()->base_dir`

Here is how to setup iterm2 to do this, although limitation here is that because of hardcoded path, this is viable for single project only:

Preferences -> Profiles - {profileName} -> Advanced -> Triggers (Edit) -> Add:
Regular Expression: `ERROR: \w+ - ([a-zA-Z\/.\d]+):(\d+)`
Action: Make Hyprelink
Parameters: `phpstorm://open?file=/Users/gabriel.ostrolucky/Documents/enrola/project/\1&line=\2`

Done

![Screenshot 2020-05-24 at 14 08 47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/496233/82753756-7464bb00-9dc8-11ea-9042-d1b2efdf27c9.png)

issue.title: Add option to show link to source in console output

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
It adds `--php-storm` option to `psalm` command, which make console output fit to phpStorm pattern of source links (`\n at {file}:{line}:{col}\n`)

I see two problems in this PR: 1) option name is not very good, and 2) this pattern is not documented (but stacktrace printed like this).

For me this option is very handy (also, it was requested here #3271 ), I'll be glad of any suggestions, how this can be done.

body: Hi everyone, I have published a small wrapper for psalm, to provide this functionallity - https://github.com/the-toster/psalm-fmt

I noticed this is source and I am tad confused what the `phpstorm` format accomplishes, is `at...` line supposed to be picked up automatically by it (that doesn't happen for me)? Is it meant to be additionally configured with storm somehow?
Ok, from a lot of going in circles it seems it needs to be an _absolute_ path to get recognized by storm, see https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-154439

issue.title: Changed path output in PhpStorm report to absolute

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Needs to be absolute to be recognized and linked up by PhpStorm terminal (at least for me on Windows).

See #3271, https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-154439

body:
For me it works with relative path, but, maybe this related to psr-4 configuration (`lounge-eloquent-connector` is a namespace root):
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22966096/92582463-a9265080-f299-11ea-8d55-8f9ccad86cfe.png)

I couldn't make it work with relative no matter what (output a bunch of paths in every way possible) and same complaints on YouTrack issue. Absolute is probably most foolproof here between projects/OSes.
This isn't solved. Even when using `vendor/bin/psalm --output-format=phpstorm`, there is no link to source code to be clicked in the output.

issue.title: Improve PhpStormReport with source code links

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications
